bioghist.p: James D. Brown worked for COEMAR, beginning in 1969, as Regional Personnel Consultant for the Middle East and Africa. In this role he was responsible for personnel studies, special field projects in personnel development, and personnel development interviewing.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James D. Brown. The bulk of the collection consists of reports, including Personnel Development Interview Reports with various missionaries, 1969-1979, and reports by Brown ("Field Conversations: An Experiment in Personal Communication"), in Iran, Hong Kong, Guatemala, India, Korea, Indonesia, and other locations. These reports detail COEMAR's history in the region, economic, cultural, and communications conditions, status of other Christian missions, and summary statistics on the attitudes and experiences of mission workers. The collection also includes slides from the third assembly of the World Council of Churches, 1961 (with a script to accompany the slides) and slides from various trips to Asia, the Middle East, and Africa in the 1960s and 1970s.
